title: Decadent fonts?
content:
Just when you thought people had run out of ways to misuse Orwell's critique of how people (ab)use language, along comes another:

[http://www.citizen-journal.net/gmhome/archives/00000177.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042905/http:/www.citizen-journal.net/gmhome/archives/00000177.htm "http://www.citizen-journal.net/gmhome/archives/00000177.htm")

I bet there are folks on the site who could come up with typefaces that would suit this gentleman's tastes. Any takers?
author: Maurice Meilleur

comments.content:
He is right to detest the crudely-rendered fonts that are patronizingly used to stereotype children's material. But the argument he develops from this is completely divorced from reality, and his hatred for childhood is disturbing.

\>typefaces that would suit this gentleman’s tastes.

Fontesque.
The article may not be beautiful but it is largely and essentially correct.

We chatted about the [same article](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042905/http:/typophile.com/node/13231) last June as well as an another article [Sans-Serif? Sans-Any Sense of Decency or Responsibillity!](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042905/http:/www.daddytypes.com/archive/2005/06/19/sansserif_sansany_sense_of_decency_or_responsibility.php), spawned by the original.
